data.title: An Oasis of Serenity in New Haven
data.text: A terrific array of teas in a peaceful setting. Friendly, helpful service. Best of all, you can sip and relax without being rushed. Exactly what a tea house experience should be.

data.title: A Hiddden Gem in a Teacup
data.text:
This stunning little tea shop is an elegant  calm oasis with a shortmenu of delicious treats and a vast array of tea.It is unique.

Noodle dishes are wonderful. Sniff test little samples of teas and take some home. 
Not inexpensive but can't find many of these varieties anywhere else. Charming servers. Love this place. Will return.
As with any place in New Haven the on street parking is a bear.

data.title: Great ambiance and tea selection
data.text: Love to come to the tea house and try their amazing selection of teas.  The service is great.  The atmosphere is great.

data.title: A treasure trove of teas.
data.text: Lovely selection of teas. We had a free sample before we bought. Lovely atmosphere inside. A restful haven to relax and enjoy your tea.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: My friend and I stopped in on a humid afternoon to treat ourselves to a refreshing iced tea.  We took advice from the server and ordered a blueberry mixed tea to go.  The tea was just OK and was very expensive for what we got.  Not sure I will give this spot a second chance.

data.title: Relaxing over Traditional Tea Service
data.text: While visiting New Hven, CT this afternoon, I stopped in to The Green TeaHouse to say hi to the owner, Ting,  who I had previously met at her other Green Teahouse in Blue Back Square in West Hartford, CT.  She served us a lovely tea with a delicate caramel fragrance and taste. The tea was served in the traditional way.  The whole experience can be  described as calming and meditative. The ambience of the Teahouse is lovely. Ting's family in China blends the teas and there are many to choose from.  I have purchased the macha and chais to brew at home.

data.title: Charming, Authentic, Delicious
data.text:
My sister, 13-year old niece and I went to The Green Teahouse and had an excellent experience.

Our waiter was funny, knowledgeable and enthusiastic.  The tea menu was extensive, but we were finally able to make our selections.  It was delicious and the presentation was so pretty.  We each received a tray with a steeping pot, holding pot (so the tea doesn’t over-steep and become bitter) and a teacup.  There were accompanying pistachio cookies in their own little tray, too.  My sister ordered Red Jade tea (definitely worth the extra cost), served in a slightly more formal style.

We ordered lunch and again, found it to be great to look at and eat.  We ordered and shared chicken teriyaki dumplings, peanut sauce noodles and the veggie combo, which are Soba Noodle and Tea-infused Jasmine Rice Pockets.  We kept commenting on how wonderful all the food was.

The ambiance was lovely...Asian decor, warm and welcoming.  

Sadly we didn't leave room for dessert, but I’m going back soon for tea and petit fours or cheesecake.

data.title: A treasure in New Haven
data.text:
First is the tea urn on the street offering samples of some of dozens of hot or iced tea on offer. The atmosphere is soothing an elegant. Lots of dark wood and soft lighting.
Food first rate from a brief menu. Not immediately evident that they serve lunch, not just tea. Small bowls are sufficient and leave room for the extraordinary desserts. 

Serve is exceptional.

data.title: What a wonderful surprise!
data.text: We were looking for a place to eat before going to see a show at the Shubert.  There was a host outside the Green Teahouse offering samples of tea.  He informed us that they also had food so we decided to try it.  We all enjoyed the tea, but especially my daughter.  They got a kick out of tea tray, fancy small spoons and fun honey dispenser.  We tried the emperors and strawberry slim tea and both were delicious.  We also ordered dumplings, 3 noodle dishes, and a panini.  Everything was excellent but most memorable were the chicken dumplings and the peanut noodles ~ I actually dreamed out them later in the night!

data.title: A Little Piece of Heaven
data.text:
We decided to warm up with a pot of tea before going out for a late dinner.  The Green Teahouse was a wonderful surprise.  Peaceful, gently lighted with lanterns and candles, ambient music pulls you into the welcoming space.  The staff was extremely knowledgeable and friendly.  We sat near the window and had a great view of chapel street while enjoying tea and home made cookies.  
Will definitely go back next time we're in New Haven.

data.title: Surprised
data.text: cool place....great tea...good dumplings....good location..good snack before or after a night of drinking!

data.title: Relaxing, delicious tea
data.text: Went with a group, beautiful decor, very relaxing atmosphere.  Good service from knowledgeable staff who were able to answer any questions we had.  The tea was delicious I had Cranberry Fig tea which was very flavorful and comes with two tea cookies. The tea comes in a nice size pot so there is plenty and they refill the pot with hot water.  For my lunch I had the chicken teriyaki dumplings which were yummy.  Others had the sushi, shrimp pockets and turkey panini. All comments were positive- I did not hear any negative comments about the food or tea. I will go back again.....

data.title: An oasis on Chapel Street
data.text: First, I will start with how beautiful this place is. You walk in and feel like you have been transported to Japan, with dark wood and a display of various teas and accessories such as storage tins and cups in the front. There is an extensive menu of teas, with full explanations of the ingredients and notations as to which have the highest polyphenol contents, something which I am interested in. The waiter was very helpful in answering any questions we had. The tea is brought out on a little tray, which includes a container of hot water, a mug and a mesh strainer, as well as two free DELICIOUS cookies that are infused with tea. The tea is not cheap, but you can make multiple cups with the same leaves. The big surprise for me was how much I enjoyed the food. I ordered the edamame dumplings and the tofu puffs, and they were so tasty. For dessert we ordered more cookies plus chocolate mochi ice cream balls that were dusted with cocoa powder (as good as it sounds).  I can't wait to go back.

data.title: Delightful, delectable lunch.
data.text:
Our first visit to The Green Teahouse was an absolute delight. We sampled the teas for which they had taste cups. All can be enjoyed hot or cold. Once we made our selection for tea, we wandered the shop, picking out teas to take home, based on what we had tried. Many are tisanes, with no caffeine, and many are caffeinated. They have an impressive array, artfully displayed. The combinations of flavors and blends is astonishing and the ones we tried were outstanding.

The tea is served on a long, rectangular ceramic tray, with small cookies in a dish and a beautiful tea service, including a pot of tea. The staff is happy to refill the pot with hot water for a second round. The tea tray is about $10, less than a drink costs at some bars.

We had the Jasmine rice and bowl of vegetables, all tasty and delicious. Most of the lunch offerings cost $10. The dessert we chose was the petit fours and they were wonderful.

We are making this our special New Haven lunch spot from now on.
